text: Presidential elections were held in Peru in 1912. José Pardo y Barreda was elected with 81% of the vote, heading an alliance of the Civilista Party, the Liberal Alliance and the Constitutionalists.Fernando Tuesta Soldevilla (2001) Perú politítico en cifras, Friedrich Ebert Stiftung, p609 ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Candidate !Party !Votes !% |- |align=left|José Pardo y Barreda||align=left|PC−AL−C||131,289||80.82 |- |align=left|Carlos de Piérola||align=left|Democratic Party||31,151||19.18 |- |colspan=2 align=left|Total||162,440||100 |- |align=left colspan=4|Source: Tuesta |} ==References== 1912 Category:1912 elections in South America Category:1912 in Peru 1908
title: 1912 Peruvian presidential election
